intro: Micromeria schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. It has small, narrow leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
